data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: Don't be put of by the fact that this is a music venue.  This place has great pizza and meat balls.  The are making their own pizza, it has not come off a delivery truck. This is seriously good food and nice people.  They also have a seasonal mixed drinks menu that is worth exploring.  Check them out for lunch.  I feel fine taking my kids in here for lunch.

data.title: A Night Out
data.text: We came here to see one of our friends perform. Not really our kind of place but it was pretty busy and buzzing. There is food available but we didn't order anything. There appears to be two bars and at the far back is where they hold their events. Its pretty large and has a stage too along with a bar on the right hand side. There is an annoying post on one side which restricts the view to the stage. It was pretty chaotic but that was down to whoever was planning the event which I believe was not the House of Rock. You had to pay for seating at this particular event whilst every other ticket was standing only. Its a pretty grungy sort of place and everyone there seemed to be enjoying themselves.

data.title: Wonderful service!
data.text: The service from the minute we walked in the door was wonderful. The antipasta was very delicious and the pizza was good too! We will be back!

data.title: Great music and amazing food.
data.text: Really love the food at HOR. They have a good mix of shows and a variety of downtown events are hosted at the House of Rock. Pizza-pizza!

data.title: Great Food and Staff
data.text: We went for lunch and had the homemade meatballs.  They were excellent.  The place has a very relaxed and personal feel.  The owners and staff made us feel very welcome and really gave us that personal touch which was very nice.  We highly recommend this establishment!

data.title: Bait and Switch
data.text: I dined at this establishment as a part of restaurant week.  They had a killer lunch special for chicken parmesan that died the day I arrived. Three days into the event they claimed to have run out of chicken parmesan at 11am (minutes after they opened) . The waitress apologized but offered no substitute so we had the lunch special of a slice of pizza and a caesar salad for $8. All in all it was just okay. The bar is the focal point of the establishment. The decor is a glossy wood from the tables to the stools to bar.

data.title: Decent
data.text: Visiting Corpus Christi Ordered a salad, slice of pizza and a glass of wine. The salad and wine was good. I appreciated the fact that the cook made a fresh pie for me, but the crust was a little burnt. The barmaid was very friendly and informative.

data.title: Drinks/Eats, Good Music, Good Times!
data.text:
One event for our 30th high school reunion was held at House of Rock. Located downtown on the corner of Starr Street. The gem looks small from the outside, but is actually spacious, it's is divided into sections. A couple of bar sections and a music venue area. They offer a wide range of beer, craft drinks and wine. The pizza is great! Sandwiches are tasty! 
Highly recommend this place for couples, friends, groups, business meetings, etc..

data.title: Nice downtown venue for lunch!
data.text: This place is apparently known as a venue for concerts and other activities. During the day,  the bar area is open for lunch.  The big slice pizza with Caesar salad was really good.   The pizza is a thin crust,  very large slice,  with excellent mozzarella cheese.  The Caesar was simple but quite good.  The dressing tasted homemade.  The staff was very courteous and welcoming.   I was impressed with the food and service.

data.title: Wait is tooooo long
data.text: I ordered my pizza at 933pm and received It at 10:25pm. My family ordered there's after I did and received it way before I did. Yes it was a little busy but not that busy to where others way after me received there order. The ambiance was ok but will never go back for their food!

data.title: Great shows! Always promoting art and music in Corpus Christi.
data.text: This place has some great concerts and excellent atmosphere. They are one of the few businesses in Corpus Christi who works hard to help grow the small, but promising, art and music scene here. They've got some decent food too. Check out the Annual Ink Slingers Ball!

data.title: Great venue to watch live music, but don't forget they have food
data.text: This place is constantly bringing in a variety of quality live music.  Check out their website for updates.  Even though it is primarily a bar, don't forget to visit for lunch. They have great pizza, subs and decent salads.  This is a regular stop for us for a quick lunch when downtown.

data.title: the best
data.text: had a lot of fun here and the food is great! cant wait to go back. Lots of local bands playing, My friends and I really enjoyed it.
